TopicTitle: How to make a mod ON A MAC

Articles.Content: This is a simple question. How do I make a mod?

First, get a lathe.

Next, get a chunk of metal.

Finally, start lathing until it looks like something.

Make lots of good posts and make a good impression the mods, and they will consider adopting you into their family no matter what OS you are using.

It is a thankless job however and you will probably regret it.

You need to be more specific. Do you mean .cfg edits (like changing tanks to have two bajillion tons of fuel)? Or do you mean plugins (like engines that run on kitten tears)?

.cfg edits require a text editor.

Plugins require a C# compiler and a text editor.
I mean just something where I can make a part like a fuel tank and use it.

The first thing you will need is a 3D modeling program that can export DAE files. I am not familiar enough with the Mac to recommend one though.

Cheers!

Capt\'n Skunky

KSP Community Manager

Blender is a free 3D modeling program that works with mac. I have downloaded it once, so I know for sure (with Snow Leopard, not Lion). http://www.blender.org/download/get-blender/ I also know for sure that it exports in the right formats from info I got on the KSP wiki: http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/~kerbalsp/wiki/index.php?title=Part_Modelling_Guidelines There\'s also an SDK, but I have no clue what that does.
